intro: Seseli mutellina, commonly known as the Balkan seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Seseli mutellina is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
